intro: Senecio solidagineus, commonly known as the African snowbells, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, hairy stems and leaves that are typically grayish-green in color. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters that resemble bells, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
